The incorporation of graphene oxide nanosheets into a polymer matrix to create a quasi-solid-state electrolyte will lead to enhanced ionic conductivity and improved thermoelectric and mechanical performance in high-performance thermal batteries.

The incorporation of sulfonated block copolymers into a quasi-solid-state polymer electrolyte matrix will enhance ionic conductivity and improve thermoelectric and mechanical performance in high-performance thermal batteries.

The incorporation of polyionic liquids into a quasi-solid-state polymer electrolyte matrix will enhance ionic conductivity, leading to improved thermoelectric and mechanical performance in high-performance thermal batteries.
